questionnaire.name: 8. theBIKEnet Mobility Services - Shared Use, Integration and Willingness to Pay

sections.title: theBIKEnet Mobility Services Questionnaire
sections.description:
üö≤ theBIKEnet is a public research project that explores how people cycle and move through cities - combining science, technology, and everyday experience. Our goal is to make urban mobility safer, fairer, and more sustainable for everyone.

This eighth questionnaire focuses on shared and public mobility services - such as bike sharing, e-scooter sharing, and public transport. It investigates how often you use these services, how you combine them, and what improvements could make them more accessible. Your feedback will help us design better-integrated, affordable, and sustainable mobility systems.

Participation is completely voluntary and anonymous. The information you provide will be used only for scientific and educational purposes.

Learn more about theBIKEnet project

sections.title: Use of Shared and Public Mobility Services
sections.description: How frequently you use shared vehicles or public transport, and how safe and comfortable you feel while doing so.

questions.text: How often do you use bike (or e-bike) sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1-2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: How often do you use e-scooter sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1-2 times per week or at least twice per month)

questions.text: How often do you use car sharing services?

options.text: Daily (5 or more times per week)
Sometimes (1-2 times per week or at least twice per month)

sections.title: Integration and Incentives
sections.description: Your experience with integrated services and what incentives would make you use shared mobility more often.

questions.text: What factors would influence your decision to use public transport?

options.text: If it were offered shorter travel times, better connections, or more frequent services.
If there were the discounted tickets
If I had physical limitations that made cycling difficult
If it offered options like bike racks on buses or trains (for longer journeys)
When I'm running late or need to reach my destination quickly
If I felt unsafe cycling due to busy traffic, unsafe road conditions, or concerns about theft.

questions.text: If you were given free access to a shared bicycle or e-scooter, would you use it?
If you were given free bus or metro tickets, would you ride a bicycle or e-scooter more often?
What would most encourage you to use bicycle and e-scooter sharing services more often?

options.text: More reliable app or payment options

questions.text: What would most encourage you to use car sharing services more often?

options.text: More reliable app or payment options

questions.text: Do you currently use or plan to use the micromobility discount (bike, e-scooter, or car sharing) linked to your ATAC / Metrebus subscription?

options.text: Yes, I plan to activate it
I was not aware of this discount
I am not eligible or was excluded from the program

sections.title: Cost and Willingness to Pay
sections.description: How affordable you find current services and your willingness to pay for improved public transport or faster travel times.

questions.text: How affordable do you find using a bicycle or an e-scooter (personal)?
How affordable do you find using a bicycle or an e-scooter (shared)?
Would you be willing to pay a higher fare for public transport if it meant improved service quality (e.g. more frequent buses or trains)?
Would you be willing to pay a higher fare for public transport if it meant less congestion and faster travel times?

it.#8. theBIKEnet Mobility Services - Share: 8. Servizi di mobilit√† theBIKEnet ‚Äì Condivisione, integrazione e disponibilit√† a pagare
it.#theBIKEnet Mobility Services Questionna: Questionario theBIKEnet sui servizi di mobilit√†
it.#üö≤ <b>theBIKEnet</b> is a public rese:
üö≤ theBIKEnet √® un progetto di ricerca pubblico che esplora come le persone vanno in bicicletta e si muovono nelle citt√†, combinando scienza, tecnologia ed esperienza quotidiana. Il nostro obiettivo √® rendere la mobilit√† urbana pi√π sicura, pi√π equa e pi√π sostenibile per tutte le persone.

Questo ottavo questionario si concentra sui servizi di mobilit√† condivisa e pubblica ‚Äì come bike sharing, monopattini elettrici in sharing e trasporto pubblico. Analizza con quale frequenza utilizzi questi servizi, come li combini tra loro e quali miglioramenti potrebbero renderli pi√π accessibili. Il tuo feedback ci aiuter√† a progettare sistemi di mobilit√† pi√π integrati, accessibili e sostenibili.

La partecipazione √® completamente volontaria e anonima. Le informazioni che fornisci saranno utilizzate solo per scopi scientifici e didattici.

Scopri di pi√π sul progetto theBIKEnet
it.#Use of Shared and Public Mobility Servi: Uso dei servizi di mobilit√† condivisa e del trasporto pubblico
it.#How frequently you use shared vehicles: Con quale frequenza usi veicoli in sharing o il trasporto pubblico e quanto ti senti al sicuro e a tuo agio mentre li utilizzi.
it.#Daily (5 or more times per week): Ogni giorno (5 o pi√π volte a settimana)

it.#If I had physical limitations that made: Se avessi limitazioni fisiche che rendono difficile andare in bicicletta
it.#If it offered options like bike racks o: Se ci fossero opzioni come portabici su autobus o treni (per spostamenti pi√π lunghi)
it.#When I'm running late or need to reach: Quando sono in ritardo o devo arrivare rapidamente a destinazione
it.#If I felt unsafe cycling due to busy tr: Se mi sentissi insicuro/a andando in bicicletta a causa del traffico intenso, di condizioni stradali pericolose o per timore di furti.
it.#If you were given free access to a shar: Se ti venisse dato accesso gratuito a una bici o a un monopattino elettrico in sharing, lo useresti?

it.#Lower cost per trip: Costo pi√π basso per singola corsa
it.#Better integration with public transpor: Migliore integrazione con il trasporto pubblico
it.#Higher vehicle availability nearby: Maggiore disponibilit√† di veicoli nelle vicinanze

Saresti disposto/a a pagare una tariffa pi√π alta per il trasporto pubblico se questo significasse meno congestione e tempi di viaggio pi√π rapidi?
